intro: Coccocypselum rothschuhii, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is covered in dense, pale yellow to greenish-white spines. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Coccocypselum rothschuhii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
